paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant Val30Met, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy with optic neuropathy

individual_records.phenotype_details: Bilateral optic neuropathy, visual field findings suggestive of optic neuropathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: We reported a male patient in his late 40s when deceased, who previously had a liver transplant in order to reduce the abnormal protein synthesis underlying his FAP ATTR Val30Met mutation.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation is known to cause abnormal protein synthesis leading to familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family as it is associated with familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy.
variants.additional_notes: This is the first report of ischaemic optic neuropathy in this familial amyloid disorder.
key_quotes: This was also the diagnosis underlying the preceding insidious full loss of vision in the fellow eye, with colour Doppler imaging to support an ischaemic aetiology.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant was extracted from the main text.
